On Monday, February 17, 2003 15:29:09 -0500 "J. B. Rainsberger"
<jbr@...> wrote:

> I think I wrote this up in another message in this group. You should be
> able to adapt the solution to your situation.

I ended up reworking my TestCase and changed my suite() to be:

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();

String pathName = System.getProperty("test.path");
String hostName = System.getProperty("test.host");
String hostPort = System.getProperty("test.port");

System.out.println("Running test messages from: " + pathName );
File path = new File( pathName );
File[] files = path.listFiles();

for (int i = 0; i < files.length; i++) {
File file = files[i];
if ( file.getName().startsWith("test") &&
file.getName().endsWith("xml")) {
suite.addTest( new XmlMessageTest( "http", hostName,
hostPort, file ));
suite.addTest( new XmlMessageTest( "https", hostName,
hostPort, file ));
suite.addTest( new SoapMessageTest( "http", hostName,
hostPort, file ));
suite.addTest( new XmlMessageTest( "https", hostName,
hostPort, file ));
}
}

return suite;
}


Seems to be working fine.
